output: • Server Components are the default in Next.js 15
• Direct database access is allowed in server components
• Handle not found cases with notFound() from next/navigation
• Pass data to client components as props

best_practices: Prefer server components over client components for better performance
Validate all inputs using Zod in server actions
Use Suspense boundaries for progressive loading experiences
anti_patterns: Avoid using 'use client' unless interactivity is required
Do not fetch data in client components when server components can handle it
Avoid API routes when server actions would be simpler

faq.question: What are the main differences from Pages Router?
faq.answer: App Router uses server components by default, replaces getServerSideProps with async components, and introduces server actions for mutations.

faq.question: When should I use server actions vs API routes?
faq.answer: Use server actions for form submissions and mutations. Use API routes only for client-side requests or external API integrations.

faq.question: How do I share state between routes?
faq.answer: Use context providers in a layout component. Context persists across route changes in the same layout scope.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using server components?
faq.answer: Yes. Server components run only on the server. Sensitive data like database queries never reach the client.

faq.question: How do I debug server component issues?
faq.answer: Check server logs, use React DevTools to verify component types, and ensure proper error boundaries are in place.

faq.question: Can I use this with TanStack Query?
faq.answer: Yes. Use TanStack Query in client components for client-side caching and server components for initial data fetching.
